title: 111_hr4527
content: The Act may be cited as the "Corporate and Labor Electioneering Advertisement Reform Act" or the "CLEAR Act." It includes statements in campaign-related communications funded by corporations or labor organizations. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to require a disclosure statement in corporate or labor organization communications transmitted through radio or television. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to require disclosure statements in corporate or labor organization communications transmitted through radio or television. The disclosure statement must be clearly spoken in audio for radio and included in television transmissions. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to require disclosure statements in corporate or labor organization communications transmitted through radio or television. The disclosure statement must be conveyed clearly in audio for radio and visually with a logo in television transmissions for at least 4 seconds. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to require disclosure statements in corporate or labor organization communications transmitted through radio or television. The disclosure statement must be conveyed clearly in audio for radio and visually with a logo in television transmissions for at least 4 seconds. The disclosure statement includes the name and title of the individual and the name of the corporation or labor organization. In this paragraph, the term 'applicable individual' refers to the CEO of a corporation or the highest-ranking officer of a labor organization. 'Corporate communication' is a communication paid for by a corporation, excluding those paid for by a separate fund. 'Labor organization communication' is a communication paid for by a labor organization. The term 'communication' refers to a communication paid for by a labor organization, excluding those paid for by a separate fund. The amendment applies to communications made after the enactment of this Act.
